adjective.description: Situated in or directed towards the south-east. Also of a wind: blowing from the south-east.

adverb.description: In a south-eastwardly direction; towards the south-east.

origin: Early 18th century. From south + eastwardly. Compare south-eastward, south-eastward<br>early 18th century. From south-eastward + -ly, after eastwardly.
